tit.e: Keizu sanyo (pedigree charts of Edo period)

sen.j: 系図纂要（けいずさんよう）は、江戸時代末期の系譜集成。
sen.e: Keizu sanyo (pedigree charts of Edo period) is an aggregation of pedigree charts in the end of the Edo Period.
Keizu sanyo (Edo period pedigree charts) is a collection of pedigree charts compiled in the late Edo Period.
Keizu sanyo (Edo period pedigree charts) is a collection of pedigree charts compiled in the late Edo Period.
A total of 102 volumes (103 volumes)
It comes in 102 volumes (103 books).
It comes in 102 volumes (103 books).

sen.j: 著者は『大日本野史』の著者でもある飯田忠彦とみられる。
sen.e: The author seems to be Tadahiko IIDA who wrote "Dai Nihon Yashi" (Unofficial History of Japan).
The author is considered to be Tadahiko IIDA who wrote "Dai Nihon Yashi" (Unofficial History of Japan).
The author is considered to be Tadahiko IIDA who wrote "Dai Nihon Yashi" (Unofficial History of Japan).

sen.j: 既存の系譜集や記録などを広く集めて再編纂しており、史料価値が高いとされる。
sen.e: He collected and edited various existing pedigree records and other documents, which were considered to have high value as historical materials.
He compiled and edited various existing pedigree records and other documents, and the publication is considered a highly valuable historical source.
He compiled and edited various existing pedigree records and other documents, and the publication is considered a highly valuable historical source.

sen.j: 水戸藩の『大日本史』編纂に対して諸国から情報が集められていたが、そのなかで系図も集まっていた。
sen.e: When compiling "Dainihonshi" (Great history of Japan) of Mito Domain, information was collected from various countries, and family trees were also included.
When compiling "Dainihonshi" (Great history of Japan), Mito Domain gathered information from around the country, including pedigree records.
When compiling "Dainihonshi" (Great history of Japan), Mito Domain gathered information from around the country, including pedigree records.

sen.j: この系譜を収録したのが『諸家系図纂』であった。
sen.e: "Shoka keizusan" (the genealogies of the various families) contains the pedigree records.
These pedigree records were collected into "Shoka keizusan" (the genealogies of the various families).
These pedigree records were collected into "Shoka keizusan" (the genealogies of the various families).

sen.j: しかしこれらの系譜のなかには異なる伝承を持ち数種類の系図が存在するものも多かった。
sen.e: Many pedigree records have different traditions and there are several versions of family trees.
Many pedigree records have different traditions and there are several versions of family trees.
Many pedigree records have different traditions and there are several versions of family trees.

sen.j: この問題に対して編纂されたのが『系図纂要』である。
sen.e: "Keizu sanyo" (pedigree charts of Edo period) was compiled to solve this problem.
"Keizu Sanyo" (Pedigree Charts of the Edo Period) was compiled to solve this problem.
"Keizu Sanyo" (Edo Period Pedigree Charts) was compiled to solve this problem.
sen.cmt: タイトルに表記をそろえました。

sen.j: 系図の古典たる『尊卑分脈』を『諸家系図纂』に結びつけて再編纂しただけでなく、『寛政重修諸家譜』『藩翰譜』『諸家伝』『地下家伝』など先行の系図集や文献・地誌・記録類を広く渉猟し参考にして、宮家、藤原氏・菅原氏・紀氏・平氏・諸源氏などの諸氏・諸家ごとに集大成している。
sen.e: "Sonpibunmyaku", a classic genealogy, was reedited according to "Shoka keizusan" (the genealogies of the various families), existing family trees, literature, local reports and records, such as "Kansei Choshu Shokafu" (genealogies of vassals in Edo Bakufu), "Hankanpu" (Genealogy of the Protectors of the Shogunate), "Record of family trees", "Jigekaden" (a record of family trees of Jige, lower rank court officials, written by Kagefumi MIKAMI), were studied and referenced, and pedigree charts were compiled by family and clan, such as Miyake (house of an imperial prince), Fujiwara clan, Sugawara clan, Ki clan, Taira clan and Genji.
sen.cmt: 諸家伝はRecord of family treesと仮訳しました。
sen.e: "Sonpibunmyaku", a classic genealogy, was reedited according to "Shoka keizusan" (the genealogies of the various families), existing family trees, literature, local reports and records, such as "Kansei Choshu Shokafu" (genealogies of vassals in Edo Bakufu), "Hankanpu" (Genealogy of the Protectors of the Shogunate), "Record of family trees", "Jigekaden" (a record of family trees of Jige, lower rank court officials, written by Kagefumi MIKAMI), were studied and referenced, and pedigree charts were compiled by family and clan, such as Miyake (house of an imperial prince), Fujiwara clan, Sugawara clan, Ki clan, Taira clan and Genji.

"Sonpibunmyaku", a classic genealogy, was reedited according to "Shoka keizusan" (the genealogies of the various families), existing family trees, literature, local reports and records, such as "Kansei Choshu Shokafu" (genealogies of vassals in Edo Bakufu), "Hankanpu" (Genealogy of the Protectors of the Shogunate), "Record of family trees", "Jigekaden" (a record of family trees of Jige, lower rank court officials, written by Kagefumi MIKAMI), were studied and referenced, and pedigree charts were compiled by family and clan, such as Miyake (house of an imperial prince), Fujiwara clan, Sugawara clan, Ki clan, Taira clan, and various Minamoto clans.
sen.cmt: 文末の「諸源氏」の訳を訂正しました。

sen.j: また大名・主要な幕臣・公家・社家などを収録範囲とし、可能な限り幕末まで系譜を伸ばしている。
sen.e: Daimyo (Japanese feudal lords), main shogun's retainers, court nobles and shaka were covered and pedigree records were extended to the end of Edo period.
Daimyo (Japanese feudal lords), main shogun's retainers, court nobles and shaka were covered and pedigree records were extended to the end of Edo period.

Daimyo (Japanese feudal lords), main shogun's retainers, court nobles and shake (family of Shinto priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis) were covered and pedigree records were extended to the end of Edo period.

sen.j: 正確な成立年は不明だが、内容の下限は安政3年（1856年）であることと、著者とみられる飯田が万延元年（1860年）に死去していることから、この時期に成立したとみられている。
sen.e: The precise year of establishment is unknown, but since the earliest date is 1856 and the author Iida died in 1860, it is considered that it was established in this period.
The precise year in which it was written is unknown, but since the earliest date is 1856 and the author Iida died in 1860, it is considered that it was completed during this period.
The precise year in which it was compiled is unknown, but since the earliest date is 1856 and the presumed author Iida died in 1860, it is considered that it was completed during this period.
sen.cmt: writtenをcompiledに、authorをpresumed authorに修正しました。

sen.j: はじめに略系、次に詳しい本系を載せる形式をとる。
sen.e: An outline is provided first and then details are given.
An outline is provided first and then details are given.
An outline is provided first and then details are given.

sen.j: また大きな特徴として、異説の系譜を本系図中途に併記しており、後世の参考になるように系譜伝承の違いが示されている。
sen.e: It has marked characteristics that different opinions are shown in family trees and differences between traditions of pedigree records are shown for future reference.
A major feature is that differing theories are shown in family trees and differences between traditions of pedigree records are shown for future reference.
A major feature is that differing theories are shown in family trees and differences between traditions of pedigree records are shown for future reference.

sen.j: 寛政期以降の系図を収録する貴重な史料であり、その収録内容の多さから「幕末期の『尊卑分脈』」ともいえるものである。
sen.e: Since it is a valued historical document that contains family trees after the Kansei era and covers a wide range of materials, it can be compared to '"Sonpibunmyaku" in the end of the Edo period'.
Since it is a valued historical document that contains family trees from after the Kansei era and covers a wide range of materials, it can be said to be a "Sonpibunmyaku" of the late Edo period.
Since it is a valued historical document that contains family trees from after the Kansei era and covers a wide range of materials, it can be said to be a "Sonpibunmyaku" of the late Edo period.

sen.j: ただし原典に忠実であるようにしているため、従来の系譜をそのまま利用しており、自分の家を勝手に有名な系図へ結びつけるという系図の仮冒を、校正せずにそのまま書いているという問題も存在する。
sen.e: Since it was designed to be faithful to originals, existing pedigree records were used as they were, there is a problem that some families were intentionally linked to famous families and such errors were not corrected.

Since it was designed to be faithful to originals, existing pedigree records were used as they were, and there is a problem that some families were intentionally linked to famous families and such errors were not corrected.

Since it was designed to be faithful to originals, existing pedigree records were used as they were, and there is a problem that some families were intentionally linked to famous families and such errors were not corrected.

sen.j: 内閣文庫に原本があり、東京大学史料編纂所に謄写本がある。
sen.e: The original book was stored in the Cabinet Library and a copy was retained in the Historiographical Institute at the University of Tokyo.
The original book is stored in the Cabinet Library and a copy is retained in the Historiographical Institute at the University of Tokyo.
The original book is stored in the Cabinet Library and a copy is retained in the Historiographical Institute at the University of Tokyo.

sen.j: しかし異本もありこの2つが正しく伝わっているかは不明である。
sen.e: It is unknown whether these two books are correct because there are several alternative versions.
It is unknown whether these two books are correct because there are several alternative versions.
It is unknown whether these two books are correct because there are several alternative versions.
